meanings.definition: A vegetable with a dense cluster of florets on a central stem.
meanings.sent1: I cooked a delicious cauliflower for dinner.
meanings.sent2: The cauliflower at the market looked fresh and crisp.
meanings.sent3: The cauliflower wore a tiny hat made of broccoli.
meanings.sent4: Her brain felt like a cauliflower after studying for hours.
meanings.sent5: The cauliflower resembled a beautiful white bouquet.

meanings.definition: The edible white flesh of the cauliflower plant.
meanings.sent1: She added cauliflower to the soup for extra flavor.
meanings.sent2: The chef used cauliflower in the creamy pasta dish.
meanings.sent3: The cauliflower giggled when it heard it was going to be eaten.
meanings.sent4: His words were as light and fluffy as cauliflower.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of cauliflower filled the kitchen with warmth.
